messages.message:
Hi, we’ve got a blocking bug for our paying customer FinTru.

If you create an app with multiple classes, but your batch during run doesn’t have all the classes, you can’t pick that class in the review screen. In other words, to be able to assign all classes in review, you need your batch to include at least one of all of the classes.

https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1118

Loom: https://www.loom.com/share/a6005e20b8fb4bfe995f3486be72eb01

@Kerry
@Travis, how are we listing classes in Commercial Human Review?
The classes are from the zero shot endpoint.
Be at my desk in 15 or so.
I’m building an app to reproduce locally. Then I will know how to proceed

we make two separate schema calls (zero shot, and aihub/build/schema) and both return all of the classes regardless of docs in the results. I’ll be able to update the results page and show all available classes for a given app result. I’ll backport depending on size of work.
if both return all classes, then what’s causing this bug to show up?
we aren’t using those to populate the list of classes to change to
it’s using all classes collected from the results. So if only one record is in there, we only see whatever class that record has.
this is merged and backported to 49
